entry.bulbasaur: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
entry.ivysaur: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
entry.venusaur: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
entry.charmander: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
entry.charmeleon: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
entry.charizard: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
entry.squirtle: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
entry.wartortle: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
entry.blastoise: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
entry.caterpie: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
entry.metapod: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
entry.butterfree: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
entry.weedle: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.
entry.kakuna: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.
entry.beedrill: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
entry.pidgey: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
entry.pidgeotto: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
entry.pidgeot: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
entry.rattata: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.
entry.raticate: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
entry.spearow: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
entry.fearow: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
entry.ekans: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.
entry.arbok: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
entry.pikachu: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
entry.raichu: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
entry.sandshrew: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
entry.sandslash: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
entry.nidoranf: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
entry.nidorina: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
entry.nidoqueen: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.
entry.nidoranm: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.
entry.nidorino: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
entry.nidoking: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.
entry.clefairy: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
entry.clefable: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.
entry.vulpix: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
entry.ninetales: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.
entry.jigglypuff: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
entry.wigglytuff: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
entry.zubat: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
entry.golbat: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
entry.oddish: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
entry.gloom: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
entry.vileplume: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
entry.paras: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
entry.parasect: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
entry.venonat: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
entry.venomoth: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
entry.diglett: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.
entry.dugtrio: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
entry.meowth: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
entry.persian: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
entry.psyduck: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.
entry.golduck: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
entry.mankey: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
entry.primeape: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
entry.growlithe: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.
entry.arcanine: A Pokémon that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
entry.poliwag: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.
entry.poliwhirl: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.
entry.poliwrath: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
entry.abra: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.
entry.kadabra: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.
entry.alakazam: Its brain can outperform a super-computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
entry.machop: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
entry.machoke: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entry.machamp: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
entry.bellsprout: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
entry.weepinbell: It spits out PoisonPowder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
entry.victreebel: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
entry.tentacool: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
entry.tentacruel: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
entry.geodude: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
entry.graveler: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
entry.golem: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
entry.ponyta: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
entry.rapidash: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
entry.slowpoke: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
entry.slowbro: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
entry.magnemite: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
entry.magneton: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
entry.farfetch'd: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
entry.doduo: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
entry.dodrio: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
entry.seel: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
entry.dewgong: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
entry.grimer: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
entry.muk: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
entry.shellder: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entry.cloyster: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
entry.gastly: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
entry.haunter: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
entry.gengar: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
entry.onix: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
entry.drowzee: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
entry.hypno: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
entry.krabby: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
entry.kingler: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
entry.voltorb: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.
entry.electrode: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
entry.exeggcute: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
entry.exeggutor: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
entry.cubone: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.
entry.marowak: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
entry.hitmonlee: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
entry.hitmonchan: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.
entry.lickitung: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
entry.koffing: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
entry.weezing: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.
entry.rhyhorn: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
entry.rhydon: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.
entry.chansey: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
entry.tangela: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.
entry.kangaskhan: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.
entry.horsea: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
entry.seadra: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
entry.goldeen: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.
entry.seaking: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
entry.staryu: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
entry.starmie: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
entry.mr. mime: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.
entry.scyther: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
entry.jynx: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
entry.electabuzz: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
entry.magmar: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
entry.pinsir: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.
entry.tauros: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
entry.magikarp: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
entry.gyarados: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
entry.lapras: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.
entry.ditto: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
entry.eevee: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element Stones.
entry.vaporeon: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
entry.jolteon: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.
entry.flareon: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.
entry.porygon: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
entry.omanyte: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
entry.omastar: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.
entry.kabuto: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
entry.kabutops: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
entry.aerodactyl: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.
entry.snorlax: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
entry.articuno: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
entry.zapdos: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.
entry.moltres: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
entry.dratini: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.
entry.dragonair: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.
entry.dragonite: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
entry.mewtwo: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.
entry.mew: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
entry.chikorita: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.
entry.bayleef: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.
entry.meganium: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.
entry.cyndaquil: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
entry.quilava: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
entry.typhlosion: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
entry.totodile: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.
entry.croconaw: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
entry.feraligatr: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
entry.sentret: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
entry.furret: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
entry.hoothoot: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
entry.noctowl: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
entry.ledyba: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
entry.ledian: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
entry.spinarak: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
entry.ariados: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It is hard to tell which end is which.
entry.crobat: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
entry.chinchou: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.
entry.lanturn: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.
entry.pichu: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
entry.cleffa: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
entry.igglybuff: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
entry.togepi: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
entry.togetic: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
entry.natu: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
entry.xatu: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
entry.mareep: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
entry.flaaffy: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
entry.ampharos: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
entry.bellossom: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
entry.marill: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
entry.azumarill: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
entry.sudowoodo: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.
entry.politoed: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
entry.hoppip: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.
entry.skiploom: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
entry.jumpluff: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.
entry.aipom: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
entry.sunkern: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.
entry.sunflora: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
entry.yanma: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
entry.wooper: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
entry.quagsire: This carefree Pokémon has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
entry.espeon: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy's actions.
entry.umbreon: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.
entry.murkrow: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
entry.slowking: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
entry.misdreavus: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
entry.unown: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
entry.wobbuffet: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
entry.girafarig: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
entry.pineco: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.
entry.forretress: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
entry.dunsparce: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
entry.gligar: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
entry.steelix: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.
entry.snubbull: Although it looks frightening, it is actually kind and affectionate. It is very popular among women.
entry.granbull: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
entry.qwilfish: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.
entry.scizor: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
entry.shuckle: The Berries it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.
entry.heracross: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies then lifts and throws them.
entry.sneasel: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.
entry.teddiursa: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.
entry.ursaring: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen Berries.
entry.slugma: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.
entry.magcargo: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.
entry.swinub: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
entry.piloswine: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
entry.corsola: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty.
entry.remoraid: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.
entry.octillery: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
entry.delibird: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
entry.mantine: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if Remoraid attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.
entry.skarmory: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.
entry.houndour: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
entry.houndoom: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.
entry.kingdra: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.
entry.phanpy: It swings its long snout around playfully, but because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.
entry.donphan: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
entry.porygon2: This upgraded version of Porygon is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.
entry.stantler: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
entry.smeargle: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.
entry.tyrogue: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
entry.hitmontop: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dance-like kicks, you may get drilled hard.
entry.smoochum: Its lips are the most sensitive parts on its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.
entry.elekid: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.
entry.magby: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.
entry.miltank: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
entry.blissey: Anyone who takes even one bite of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
entry.raikou: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.
entry.entei: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.
entry.suicune: Said to be the reincarnation of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
entry.larvitar: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
entry.pupitar: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its Thrashing can topple a mountain.
entry.tyranitar: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.
entry.lugia: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea because its powers are too strong.
entry.ho-oh: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent seven-colored wings.
entry.celebi: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.
entry.treeko: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
entry.grovyle: The leaves growing out of Grovyle's body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémon is a master at climbing trees in jungles.
